intro: Electrosperma, commonly known as the electric spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its most notable feature is the presence of a latex-like substance that can cause skin irritation. Electrosperma is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
